Roles and Permissions

Lesson
objectives

* Describe how security is managed in

PolicyCenter using roles, permissions, and
producer codes

Explain the process of granting permissions to
roles

Explain the process of assigning roles to
users

Define the security dictionary

Darren

Insurance

Product Manager | | do not want our customers service representatives to be
able to see the same things that the underwriters see. Is
there a way to control who sees what?

| Access G

Access is the ability to see and do things within PolicyCenter based on your user
identity

| Security in PolicyCenter

¢ Security is provided using:
Role Permissions Producer codes

Ae &

« Auser must be assigned a role with the appropriate permissions
* Inthe base configuration, the Superuser role:
* is granted all permissions

* is responsible for granting permissions to other roles

| System permissions

A system permission is a granular ability to see or do something within

PolicyCenter
View mS View ome View ean
Edit sso S

Edit groups
Own sctviiee

| Permissions can influence access

Whether a user has a given permission can determine what they can:
« View/navigate to
* Create, edit, and/or delete
* Own

| Roles

Gi

Arole is a named collection of permissions used to simplify the assignment of

permissions to users

* Typically, a role maps to a job title or a job function

Underwriter Assistant

View account

&

Create account
Create activities

Edit submission
Edit rewrite

Underwriter

Ae,

View account
View sensitive notes
View sensitive docs

Create account
Create activities
Create audit

Edit submission
Edit rewrite
Edit rates and premium overrides

| Mapping roles to users Gi

Each user is given one or more roles

« Auser has all the permissions of the roles s/he is given

Dennis Right Bruce Baker Rick Ralston

@ @
ey «©

 £&

rs Ce
Underwriter Underwriter Underwriter
Assistant Supervisor

| Role Types Gi

« Adding a type to a role indicates which entities that role can be assigned
¢ Arole that can be assigned to a producer code is a producer code role

« Auser producer code role can be assigned to either users or producer codes

Role types in PolicyCenter

Producer Code Role
User Producer Code Role

User Role

| Creating producer code roles Gi

¢ Create roles with role type as producer code role or user producer code role
« Attach them to producer codes

¢ Assign producer codes to users, policies, or accounts

User

ou
a

= eee a Policy
Account

Producer Code
“¢ N

| Access for users with producer code security on Gi

* Can access accounts, policies, or jobs with matching producer codes

¢ Authorization is controlled by the intersection of the permissions in the producer
code role and the user role

Marcus
Business
Analyst

Where do | set up and assign roles in
PolicyCenter?

| Managing roles Gi
¢ Administration> Users & Security > Roles

¢ Accessing the Roles list view requires the "Manage Roles" permission that
determines whether a user can edit/create roles

Roles

(1-15 0f29) 1 -BB *

Description
User Role Permissions for audit examiner
Audit Supervisor User Role Permissions for audit supervisor
Claims Adjuster User Producer Code Role Base permissions for a claims adjuster

Roles can be filtered

| Creating a new role

Fern >

Enter name
Choose role type
Specify if this is an internal role only

Add permissions

Modifying permissions in a role Gi

Roles
Role: Audit Examiner

Basics | Users

Role 1

Type User Role

Advance audit > | advanceaudit Permission to advance audits

Marcus
Business
Analyst

Is there any way to get a quick view of all
the roles and associated permissions?

| Security dictionary Gi

The security dictionary is a series of HTML pages that document the permissions
and roles in your application
« Location: <server directory>\build\dictionary\security\index.html

« When permissions or roles are added or edited , regenerate the information to reflect the
changes

* The dictionary has four main sections

| Demonstration G
Security dictionary

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Question

,~ — Name some of the user roles in PolicyCenter.

4
¢
¢

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Answer

¢
¢
¢
¢

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

Name some of the user roles in PolicyCenter.

Underwriter, Producer, Auditor, Underwriter assistant...

Question

,~ — When does PolicyCenter determine which permissions a given user

? 2
y has?
4

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Gi

Answer

¢
¢
¢
¢

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

When does PolicyCenter determine which pennissions a given user
has?

PolicyCenter determines the permissions for a given user when that user logs in and
every time when the user queries the server.

Gi

Question

_~ — How many permissions can a given role have?

4
¢
¢

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Answer

¢
¢
¢
¢

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

How many pemnissions can a given role have?

Arole can have any number of permissions. PolicyCenter has certain zero-permission
roles in the base product to act as placeholders.

Question

,~ — How many roles can a given user have?

4
¢
¢

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Answer Gi

,~ — How many roles can a given user have?

¢
¢
¢

Auser can have any number of roles. A user must have at least one role in order to be
able to work in PolicyCenter. A user with broader responsibility can be given additional
roles so that they are able to accomplish these responsibilities.

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

Question

,~ — How could you easily determine which roles enable users to create

x accounts?
7

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Gi

Answer Gi

,~ — How could you easily determine which roles enable users to create
¢ accounts?

¢
¢

View the create accounts permissions in the security dictionary to see which roles the
permission has been added to.

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

objectives
review

* Describe how security is managed in

PolicyCenter using roles, permissions, and
producer codes

Explain the process of granting permissions to
roles

Explain the process of assigning roles to
users

Define the security dictionary
